There has been a [book on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/MIRACULOUS-RESULTS-EXTREMELY-SUNSHINE-EXPERIMENT-ebook/dp/B005FCKN2S) where the author claims to have had significant healing effects from megadosing Vitamin D3 (50,000IU - 100,000IU per day if I remember correctly, combined with high doses of Vitamin K2 and Magnesium). This dose of Vitamin D3 is very high, and the author took Vitamin K2 and Magnesium to offset the toxicity. He says it helped him with a few chronic issues he's been dealing with for years. However, I've read studies that mention daily megadosing of Vitamin D3 in doses of ~150,000IU causes permanent eye and kidney damage, due to arterial calcification. So do Vitamin D megadoses are beneficial or toxic? Maybe with Vitamin K2 the toxicity is reduced and megadosing is allowed,
